official_title: Arginine With Whole Brain Radiation Therapy for the Treatment of Brain Metastases
brief_title: Arginine and Whole Brain Radiation Therapy for the Treatment of Patients With Brain Metastases
cancer_type_display: A study for patients with solid tumors that have metastasized to the brain, who are scheduled to undergo whole-brain radiation therapy.
cancer_tags: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
prior_treatments_excluded: Systemic anti-neoplastic agent concurrent with WBRT
key_inclusion_summary: Diagnosis of brain metastases from any primary cancer.
Planned to undergo whole-brain radiation therapy.
No systemic anti-neoplastic agent concurrent with WBRT (memantine is okay).
key_exclusion_summary: Patient unwilling or unable to receive daily arginine treatment.
Creatinine > 1.5 times the upper limit of normal.
ALT > 6 times the upper limit of normal.
